name: BEST WESTERN Dower House Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here in early March and I must say we weren't hugely impressed with "large" room we'd been given on arrival. It was in the "newer" section that links the old building with the health club. This part of the hotel has seen better days. The room itself was clean but a bit shabby and is quite a bit different to the "feature" rooms that you see on the website that have old oak beams. The bed was also just two twins joined together and not really very comfortable. Plus side was that the room was close to the health club which has a good pool and steam room.
reviews.title: Superb service but smoky and shabby

likes.disliked: — Smoky and the rooms are a little shabby

reviews.text: Having said all that, the food here was excellent, We had both dinner and breakfast and the service was superb. We really did want for nothing in this regard.
reviews.title: loved the Dower House.

likes.disliked: — Staff talking amongst themselves in the restaurant instead of tending to customers

reviews.text: Only other complaint is that you have to walk through the bar area to get to the rooms. And pretty much everytime we did this we had to walk through plumes of cigarette smoke.
reviews.title: Pretty good overall but minor tweaks needed

likes.disliked: — spiders in the room and an insecure door

reviews.text: The location (in Knaresborough) is an excellent base for exploring North Yorkshire and the town itself is a great little place to stay. Plenty of speciality and secondhand shops to poke around in and the views down over the town from the castle can't be beat.
reviews.title: A pleasant place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at the hotel on several occassions and always found the staff to be helpful and courteous. The only fault is that the restaurant staff were found to be talking at times rather than attending to customers. The food however was very good. I am just in the process of booking our 2008 holiday and I have just asked my 8 year old son where he wants to go. " the Dower House " he said and this was a child who has travelled the world, not quite the answer I expected having given him choices of places we had been before ie; Barbados, Antigua. Maldives, Mexico etc etc etc. The room we stayed in on our last visit was definately the best. It was a little suite away from the main hotel. The staff in the leisure centre were brilliant and discussed the comprtitors in strictly come dancing which is a subject close to my heart. I would thorougly recommend this hotel and we will be going there again, very soon.
reviews.title: Outstanding Quality and Excellence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel as a final night to our stay. We had opted for a superior room. When my husband and I opened the door to the room, we looked at the Pine Bed and the small size of the room and I went back to reception to ask had they forgotten that we had asked for a larger room. The reply I received was that we were in the one of the best and largest rooms. We were not impressed. We had a TV that was perched well below bed level on a small table and the mattress meant that we were sleeping with our legs elevated and we slid towards the headboard.
reviews.title: Very Disappointed

reviews.text: The leisure facilities were clean but small. The attitude of the staff was lacklusture. I will say that the room was clean but the decor was shabby with wardrobes that looked like they had come from the auctions after a death in the family. Unless the hotel was subjected to a full refurbishment, we would not stay again.
reviews.title: Good location, friendly staff but a little dated

reviews.text: Good points: great location and parking - within easy walking distance of the centre of Knaresborough. Staff very friendly, particularly at reception and the head waitress. Bed very comfy and everything nice and clean in the room. Good food in the restaurant in the evening and at breakfast.
reviews.title: lovely traditional hotel with fantastic food
What a pleasant place to stay
reviews.text: Downsides: it all felt a little dated to us. The restaurant was even playing hits of the eighties and seems to be permanently decorated for a wedding reception. You had to sit in the bar to order your food (no choice in the matter) and had to sign a little piece of paper to say you had got your wine. It all just felt a bit strange. The room was the same, although it was clean and comfy, the decoration seemed to hark back at least ten years - but I appreciate some people will love it all the more for that.

description: BEST WESTERN Dower House Hotel is as full of character as it is convenience, when you're not enjoying a good nights sleep, you can relax in our recently refurbished Imagine Health & Spa with a swim, treatment or work out.You'll not only enjoy the sights and sounds of the traditional market town of Knaresborough, but also the opportunity to take in beautiful river walks and historical landmarks such as Mother Shiptons Cave and the Castle ruins
